Promoting Opportunity for Disability Benefit Applicants Act
To amend titles II and XVI of the Social Security Act to provide certain individuals with information on employment support services.
Promoting Opportunity for Disability Benefit Applicants Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary:
Promoting Opportunity for Disability Benefit Applicants Act
This bill amends titles II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) and XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to allow the Social Security Administration to provide, to an individual who is denied OASDI or SSI benefits based on an adverse determination of disability, information on appropriate public or private entities that provide employment services, vocational rehabilitation services, or other support services.
